name: Coal mine water use and quality; Surface mine
description:
This process is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  To access the library and the original dataset:
1) Navigate to the NETL LCA home page (http://www.netl.doe.gov/lca)
2) Then navigate to the “Unit Process Library” 
3) From the library, the unit process of interest can be found either through the "Complete Listing of the Unit Process Library link" or through the link to the "Unit Process Database" spreadsheet
4) For each process, a Data Sheet (DS) and Data File (DF) are available

BRIEF DESCRIPTION
This unit process considers water use and quality from surface mining of coal based on data for  Powder River Basin mines.  
Inputs and outputs are reported on the basis of 1 Item of "Water use and quality; Production mix, from surface coal mine".


GOAL AND SCOPE
This parameterized unit process provides a summary of water consumption and quality associated with surface mining of coal. The data are representative of subbituminous coal from the Powder River Basin (PRB). Water flows include water required for mining and cleaning operations and wastewater flows. Storm water is included in the inventory for wastewater flows. This process is based on the reference flow of 1 Item of "Water use and quality; Production mix, from surface coal mine".  

This process differs slightly from the Detailed Spreadsheet Documentation (DS) file referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below.  Differences between this process and the DS are as follows:
1) Different reference flows.  This is because, in the openLCA model, coal is produced in a separate process.
2) Different units for input flows.  Units for inputs In the openLCA model have been converted from liters (L) to kilograms (kg) based on the densities of fresh and salt water.

BOUNDARY AND DESCRIPTION
A visual representation of the boundary of this unit process is available in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below). This unit process is based on water data for the surface mining of coal in the Powder River Basin. It is assumed that all surface mines have similar water use and quality profiles. 

Water use was estimated based on an environmental impact study completed on West Antelope II mine located in the Powder River Basin of Wyoming (BLM 2008). Water emissions, including flows and concentrations of relevant inorganic constituents and solids entering the waterstream, were taken from available National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permit reporting documentation (NPDES 2009).

Additional details regarding input and output flows, including calculation methods, are contained in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section below).


CITATIONS AND ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION
This dataset should be cited as: 
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2015. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data - Unit Process: Coal mine water use and quality; Surface mine. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: September 2015 (Version 01). Retrieved on [DATE] from [URL for this dataset].

This dataset is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  The Library offers additional information concerning this dataset in the form ofa Detailed Spreadsheet  Documentation (DS) file and a Process Documentation File (DF).  The DS file  is an Excel file that contains all ofthe parameters, inputs, and outputs for a given system as well as background data, calculations and quality scores.  The DF file is a PDFdocument that contains major assumptions and data sources that are the basis for each unit process.  The NETL Unit Process Library islocated on the NETL website (netl.doe.gov) under Research / Energy Analysis / Energy Trends and Issues / Life Cycle Analysis / Unit Process Library.

This dataset was converted directly from the DS with additional supporting information provided by the DF.  Full citations for the DS and DF are given below.

DS File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data - Unit Process: Water use and quality from surface mining of coal, based on data for PRB mines. Version 02. Retrieved on DATE  from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DS_Stage1_O_Surface_Coal_Mine_Water_2013-02.xlsx.

DF File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data - Unit Process:  Water use and quality from surface mining of coal, based on data for PRB mines. Version 02. Retrieved on DATE  from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DF_Stage1_O_Surface_Coal_Mine_Water_2013-02.pdf.

category.name: Bit. Coal and Lignite Surface Mining

processDocumentation.technologyDescription:
This process provides a summary of water consumption and quality associated with surface mining of coal. The data are representative of subbituminous coal from the Powder River Basin (PRB). Water flows include water required for mining and cleaning operations and wastewater flows. Storm water is included in the inventory for wastewater flows. It is assumed that all surface mines have similar water use and quality profiles similar to the Powder River Basin.

Additional details are contained in the associated documentation (referenced in the Citation and Associated Documentation section in the Description field).
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: All elementary and technosphere flows are calculated on a functional unit basis. Calculations involving combustion primarily to generate useful work are done using lower heating values (LHV) and calculations involving combustion primarily to generate useful heat are done using higher heating values (HHV). Unless explicitly stated in the associated reference documents applicable calculations assumed standard atmospheric temperature and pressure (SATP).
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription:
Use of this dataset is not restricted, but a statement of attribution is required. Please use the following attribution statement: 

National Energy Technology Laboratory's (NETL) Unit Process Library
626 Cochrans Mill Road, P.O. Box 10940
Pittsburgh, PA 15236-0940
http://www.netl.doe.gov/research/energy-analysis/life-cycle-analysis/unit-process-library

Neither the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) nor any person acting on behalf of these organizations:
A. Makes any warranty or representation, express or implied, with respect to the accuracy, completeness, or usefulness of the information contained in this document, or that the use of any information, apparatus, method, or process disclosed in this document may not infringe on privately owned rights; or
B. Assumes any liability with this report as to its use, or damages resulting from the use of any information, apparatus, method, or process disclosed in this document.

Reference herein to any specific commercial product, process, or service by trade name, trademark, manufacturer, or otherwise, does not necessarily constitute or imply its endorsement, recommendation, or favoring by NETL. The views and opinions of the authors expressed herein do not necessarily state or reflect those of NETL.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: This is a cradle-to-gate extraction process and can be used for any type of LCA study.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) Unit Process Library

sources.name: U.S. Bureau of Land Management (BLM). 2008. Draft Environmental Impact Study, West Antelope II Coal Lease Application, Chapter 4: Cumulative Environmental Consequences.

National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2013. Coal mine water use and quality; Surface mine
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). 2009b. National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System Permit, Water Quality Reporting Documentation
U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA). 2013. Historical Detailed Coal Production Data (1983-2011)
HKM Engineering Inc. 2002. Northeast Wyoming River Basins Water Plant Technical Memoranda, Appendix G, Industrial Water Use.
U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). 2005. Estimated Use of Water in the United States: Wyoming County-Level Data for 2005
U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). 2009. Methods for Estimating Water Withdrawals for Mining in the United States, 2005
